conversation.content: Hello doctor, I have had intermittent throat tightness for 2 years, accompanied by back pain for 5 days, and I lost consciousness 1 hour ago.
Could you please describe in detail what happened during the loss of consciousness? Approximately how long did it last? Did you have any convulsions or urinary or fecal incontinence during that time?

It was about an hour ago. I was sitting and resting when I suddenly didn’t know anything anymore. My family said my eyes rolled upward, I was sweating a lot, and my face looked extremely pale. After a few minutes, I woke up on my own. They said there were no convulsions, no jaw clenching, and no shaking of my arms or legs, and there was no loss of bowel or bladder control. After waking up, I could speak normally, and my arms and legs could move. I didn’t feel particularly uncomfortable.
Have you already had an electrocardiogram (ECG) and cardiac enzyme tests?

The ECG showed that my heartbeat was a bit slow, and there were some waveform changes in the inferior and posterior walls of the heart. The doctor has the specific values recorded. The cardiac enzyme test results are not back yet, and the doctor did not mention any specific numbers.
What were the results of your cardiac troponin I (cTnI) and cardiac troponin T (cTnT) tests? Also, have you undergone coronary angiography (CAG)?

The doctor did not tell me the specific values for troponin I or troponin T, only that they are still being observed. I have not had coronary angiography, and the doctor did not mention anything about that.
